description.p: This event fires when the Grid is initialized. It also fires when the Grid is re-initialized after a session has expired. If you want to override a Grid property, use the OnGridExecute event.

discussion.p: This event fires when the Grid is initialized. It also fires when the Grid is re-initialized after a session has expired.
*[IMPORTANT]*: The [onGridExecute] event, which fires every time the Grid is executed fires *[BEFORE]* this event. If you want to override a Grid property, use the [onGridExecute] event.

section.description: The following variables are available to you in the event:

item.name: e.rtc
item.description: Run-time calculations (allows you to pass data to other event handlers)

section.title: Example
section.example: 'Define a list for a drop-down box e.rtc.list1 = comma_to_crlf("Red,Green,Blue")

section.title: Simulating Session Variables
section.description: To simulate session variables when running in Working Preview you can use this code:
section.example: if eval_valid("request.SERVER_PROTOCOL") then if request.SERVER_PROTOCOL = "A5RES" then 'running in working preview session.var1 = "simulated value for var1" end if end if

description.p: You can also set state variables in this event. The value of any state variables will be available in all subsequent ajax callbacks (in the e.__si2 object).
